name: The Lees of Memory "We Are Siamese" (VOS008)
description:
Velocity of Sound is pleased to announce the debut single from The Lees of Memory.  This Nashville band features Nick Slack and ex-Superdrag alumni Brandon Fisher and John Davis.  The A side, "We Are Siamese", is a mind-expanding dreamscape that unfolds into a thick, dark wave of sound, bigger than any tsunami.  The B side, "Open Your Arms", is filled with so many hooks, you'll be tempted to use the melody as bait the next time you go fishing!  This single is guaranteed to get repeat listening. 

MP3 download code included.

name: The Ceiling Stares "Volcano" (VOS007)
description: Limited edition of 300 copies! "Velocity of Sound has unleashed a bigger, epic monster of a track from Pittsburgh's own The Ceiling Stares. Last time on their side of a split with The Super Vacations they played to their psych-pop talents with "Tunnel through the air", and now with slightly more room to breathe, these two tracks take a sweeping look at their new direction. "The Day the Volcano Screamed Death" b/w "River Narrows" - 7inches

name: Epic Ditch "36-HOUR" EP (VOS006)
description:
Here’s a packed to the grooves power sk8 punk 7" from Nashville’s own Epic Ditch. Having long paid their dues in various bands, John Davis was a founder of early nineties band, Superdrag and bassist Nick Raskulinecz is a Grammy award winning producer for up and comer bands like the Foo Fighters, Rush, and Alice In Chains. Adding Pegclimber's Stewart Pack and The Pink Spiders Nick Slack to the mix, this isn’t a bunch of new kids on the block. 
This single captures more than just a late night halfpipe session soundtrack, they’re shredding record needles. - 7inches

MP3 download code included.

name: The Ceiling Stares/The Super Vacations | Split 7" (VOS005)
description: The Ceiling Stares and The Super Vacations have teamed up on their latest 7-inch vinyl single, a split release from Velocity of Sound and Sweaters & Pearls Records. Each band offers up their own take on a modern psychedelic, lo-fi inspired sound from the East Coast. The Ceiling Stares track, “A Tunnel Through the Air” was originally released on a four song cassette EP, and this is the first time the Pittsburgh based band has released any material on vinyl. Heavy beats, jangly guitars, vocal harmony, and possessed organ riff jams made pressing this at 33rpm a necessity. The Super Vacations (featuring WAVVES Ryan Ulsh on drums) have a sinister psyche-pop take on their smoke filled studio with two tracks: “Hexing” and “Controller”. Dense, hazy, riff filled, fast burning blasts of rock.

name: Flesh Vehicle "Set Free" (VOS004)
description: This Nashville super group features members of Superdrag, Agent Orange, and The Shazam. Rock N Roll is a dangerous business, that's why Velocity of Sound called in the professionals. On the "Set Free" EP, Flesh Vehicle detonates four new tracks with no regard for anyone's safety. Be sure to have a blast suit on hand because this 7-inch is about to explode! These four songs are exclusive to this EP.

name: PUJOL "ANGELBABY" (VOS003)
description: Nashville’s Pujol has been recognized as “a band to watch” from SPIN and MTV. After having two releases on Jack White’s Third Man Records. “Angelbaby” is a track from Pujol's Infinity Cat Records release, X File on Main St. This is the only place you'll find “Angelbaby” and the B-Side track, "Over the Counter Culture Jam" on vinyl. Straight up garage rock.

name: Eohippus "Live Life On Opium" (VOS002)
description:
Imagine the smelly kid who spent seventh grade with his hand down his pants, saved his boogers in a jar and told girls in a deadly serious tone that he was going to get them pregnant. Now imagine three of those kids in a band. That’s Eohippus who come farting and ejaculating on the scene with this homemade masterpiece of tastelessness. Bands like the Spits, Sockeye, Live Fast Die, and Nobunny got nothing on Eohippus when it comes to the most idiotic music ever created. Songs like “Live Life on Opium” and “Burn to Burn” should give you an idea of where these guys are coming from. Description credit: Dead Beat Records

"You can't buy talent like this." --Lou Bravera

name: Lonely Planet Boy / Eohippus split (VOS001)
description: There's a very thin line between inspired dementia and stupid crap and Tardcore derelicts Eohippus finely straddle the line. On this split they give us a and raw dunderheaded piss take on rock revealing a warped tunefulness rendered more effective by luring the listener into humming the chorus of ‘Bisquick in Bakersfield’, whatever the hell that means! On the flip you get Lonely Planet Boy who go for a sad downer folky rock gem called ‘Pets’. Notably more serious than Eohippus, making for a really odd pairing for a split. 7” LIMITED TO 500 HAND NUMBERED COPIES ON BABY BLUE WAX!! Description credit: Dead Beat Records

name: Velocity of Sound 7/8 inch button
description:
These Velocity of Sound buttons are $1.99 postage paid (within USA) and are sure to give you maximum street cred!

All proceeds go to shipping supplies to help keep all our vinyl releases sold AT COST! 

Show your support, buy a button!
